decks.name: CORE
decks.description:
The CORE deck contains all the "core rules" of the game: player agendas, character cards, conditions, and random oracles.
This deck alone doesn't have specific flavor, but it can be used to build any game you want to play.

stacks.name: Core Rules
stacks.description: Core Rules are cards that tell you how to play the game.

stacks.name: Core Rules (Agenda)
stacks.description:
Agenda cards tell players what they should do during the game. You should have at least one agenda card during play.
If you aren't sure what other agenda you should have, the Principal is probably what you want.

stacks.name: Core Rules (Crisis)
stacks.description:
You can use crisis cards at different moments of the game to change the urgency or tension of a scene.
Introducing a crisis card changes the rules of card draws and flips in special situations. The crisis card is discarded once the scene ends.

stacks.name: Character (Focus)
stacks.description:
Focus cards tell us how your character gets things done in a story. A character like Han Solo has "Charm" as a focus, while Princess Leia has "Courage" and Luke Skywalker has "Instinct".
The flip side of a focus is how its use can go wrong for a character. Courage can become recklessness. Technology can fail. Magic can exact a price. And so on.

stacks.name: Character (Role)
stacks.description:
Role cards tell us what sort of story arcs surround your character. For example, a Soldier's story will be about the role of violence, while a Dreamer's story will be about the clash between their idealism and the reality they face.
The flip side of a role card talks about the challenges and hazards your character faces on their journey.

stacks.name: Character (Upbringing)
stacks.description:
Upbringing cards talk about a character's backstory, but don't stop there. They describe how characters have learned to interact with other people, and how they see the world.
The flip side of an Upbringing card is about the limitations of these visions. A character's prejudices, assumptions, and social shortcomings can come from their upbringing as well.

stacks.name: Condition
stacks.description: Condition cards let characters succeed at a cost. Rather than flipping a character card to succeed on merits or talent, you take on a drawback or complication that will affect your future actions.

front.name: The Principal
front.description:
You create and play a Principal Character (PC).
You narrate your PC's actions, reactions, and motivations. You are the final authority on what your character says or does.
prompts: Stay true to your character
Share ways for other players to help you have fun
Look for opportunities to advance your story
Support other players' stories
front.rule: Whoever plays this card is a principal. Flip for additional rules.

back.name: The Principal
back.description:
During play, you can speak from one of several agendas.
These agendas can be assigned individually to several people, or all given to a single player.
The agendas can change hands during the game. You cannot take an agenda away from someone else, but you can ask someone else to give up an agenda.
If you've been assigned an agenda, you are bound to speak from it.
back.rule: Whoever plays this card is a principal. Flip for additional rules.

front.name: The Facilitator
front.description:
You push the scene forward by directing the spotlight of attention from player to player in fun and fair ways.
Move the spotlight:
prompts: toward a PC who's at risk or in danger
toward a player who hasn't acted recently
toward a player who has an interesting idea
away from a player who finished a cool action
front.rule: Whoever plays this card is the facilitator. Flip for additional rules.

back.name: The Facilitator
back.description:
During play, you can speak from one of several agendas.
These agendas can be assigned individually to several people, or all given to a single player.
The agendas can change hands during the game. You cannot take an agenda away from someone else, but you can ask someone else to give up an agenda.
If you've been assigned an agenda, you are bound to speak from it.
back.rule: Whoever plays this card is the facilitator. Flip for additional rules.

front.name: The Lorekeeper
front.description: You oversee the background details of the game world. Defer to players whose PC's heritage, origin, or interests would supply answers to background questions.
prompts: Who was the greatest Paladin in history?
What languages might my character learn to speak?
When did the dragons disappear?
How does magic work, anyway?
front.rule: Whoever plays this card is the lorekeeper. Flip for additional rules.

back.name: The Lorekeeper
back.description:
During play, you can speak from one of several agendas.
These agendas can be assigned individually to several people, or all given to a single player.
The agendas can change hands during the game. You cannot take an agenda away from someone else, but you can ask someone else to give up an agenda.
If you've been assigned an agenda, you are bound to speak from it.
back.rule: Whoever plays this card is the lorekeeper. Flip for additional rules.

front.name: The Referee
front.description:
You adjudicate questions about the rules of the game, and make changes to the rules with the group's consent. Any player can suggest how to handle a rule, but you have the final say.
Example rulings:
prompts: Is a given card applicable to this fictional situation?
How should a given card's text be interpreted?
Is it time to create a new card?
front.rule: Whoever plays this card is the referee. Flip for additional rules.

back.name: The Referee
back.description:
During play, you can speak from one of several agendas.
These agendas can be assigned individually to several people, or all given to a single player.
The agendas can change hands during the game. You cannot take an agenda away from someone else, but you can ask someone else to give up an agenda.
If you've been assigned an agenda, you are bound to speak from it.
back.rule: Whoever plays this card is the referee. Flip for additional rules.

front.name: The Storyteller
front.description: The game also has Ensemble Characters (ECs), sometimes called Non-Player Characters (NPCs). You narrate their actions and reactions as antagonists, allies, bystanders, and so on.
prompts: Give ECs a name and identity
Find the essential humanity of every EC
Don't steal agency or spotlight from the PCs
Initiate actions that prompt a PC response
front.rule: Whoever plays this card is the storyteller. Flip for additional rules.

back.name: The Storyteller
back.description:
During play, you can speak from one of several agendas.
These agendas can be assigned individually to several people, or all given to a single player.
The agendas can change hands during the game. You cannot take an agenda away from someone else, but you can ask someone else to give up an agenda.
If you've been assigned an agenda, you are bound to speak from it.
back.rule: Whoever plays this card is the storyteller. Flip for additional rules.

front.name: Challenges
front.description:
Any player may challenge a PC's action if success or failure are both interesting.
When your PC is challenged, you must generate a hit to meet it, like flipping a character card. If you don't meet a challenge, your PC's intentions are thwarted or complications arise.
The challenge must suggest consequences for failure. "Or else nothing happens" is not a challenge. The same action cannot be challenged multiple times.
front.rule: Flip for additional rules.

back.name: Challenges
back.description: Use challenges to tune the difficulty of a situation. A risky combat scene might pose several challenges. A simple social encounter might pose only one challenge.
prompts: You're navigating rough terrain, and might fall or lose equipment
You're fighting or fleeing a dangerous monster
You're working with complex magic or technology that might malfunction
You're confronting an emotionally fraught situation
back.rule: Flip for additional rules.

front.name: X-Card
front.description:
Start the game by reading this text aloud:
"I'd like your help. Your help to make this game fun for everyone. If anything makes anyone uncomfortable in any way, just lift this card up, or simply tap it. You don't have to explain why. It doesn't matter why. When we lift or tap this card, we simply edit out anything X-Carded."
front.rule: Flip for the remainder of the text

back.name: X-Card
back.description:
Continue reading:
"And if there is ever an issue, anyone can call for a break and we can talk privately. I know it sounds funny but it will help us play amazing games together and usually I'm the one who uses the X card to protect myself from all of you! Please help make this game fun for everyone. Thank you!"
back.rule: Lay this card at the center of the play area

front.name: Uncertain Crisis
front.description:
Some situations cannot be solved by skill or virtue, but only good fortune.
When you encounter such a crisis, decide what it would take to escape it, such as leaving the area successfully.
prompts: A chaotic natural disaster, such as flooding
Navigating a complex and ever-shifting maze
Entreating with capricious spirits or divinities
front.rule: Define the scope of the crisis, and flip this card

back.name: Uncertain Crisis
back.description:
You may not flip any cards in front of you (e.g. Character cards) to generate hits.
You may flip shared cards (e.g. Plot cards) or draw/pick a new card (e.g. Condition card, Random oracle card).
back.rule: Flip this card when the crisis is past

front.name: Gauntlet Crisis
front.description:
Some situations are grueling and exhausting, wearing down your reserves faster than you can recover. Sooner or later, something has to give.
When you encounter such a crisis, decide what it would take to survive it, such as escaping an enemy or saving a friend.
prompts: A furious and violent chase
Survival in a hostile and dangerous environment
An extended and grueling magical ritual
front.rule: Define the scope of the crisis, and flip this card

back.name: Gauntlet Crisis
back.description:
No card in front of you (e.g. Character cards) may be flipped more than once to generate a hit.
You may flip group cards (e.g. Plot cards) or draw/pick a new card (e.g. Condition card, Random oracle card).
back.rule: Flip this card when the crisis is past

front.name: Overwhelming Crisis
front.description:
Some situations will wreck a character's plans and assumptions, or be so daunting they have no idea how to handle it at first.
When you encounter such a crisis, decide what it would take to survive it, such as defeating an enemy or finding shelter.
prompts: Final boss fights
Being sent to a new world
Confrontation with divine forces
front.rule: Define the scope of the crisis, and flip this card

back.name: Overwhelming Crisis
back.description:
Immediately flip all Character cards in front of all players to their back side.
Cards may be flipped back and used in the usual way from then on.
back.rule: Flip this card when the crisis is past

front.name: Courage
front.flavor: "It doesn't matter if I win. It matters if I don't try." -- Emory
front.description:
Courage is strength in the face of grief, pain, and fear.
Courage lets you fight when afraid, speak when being shouted down, stand up when you're injured, or rebuke someone you respect.
prompts: Honor or pride must be upheld
Someone or something near you has already suffered harm
Nobody else can or will take the risk
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Courage
back.flavor: "Emory! Fall back! This isn't our fight!" -- Tana
back.description: Courage can twist into cowardice or recklessness. Not everyone knows the right time to run from a battle, or when a battle really needs to be fought. And not everyone is prepared to fight every battle they face.
prompts: Boast of deeds undone or make promises you can't fulfill
Run away to avoid getting hurt, physically or emotionally
Seek glory or vengeance
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Charm
front.flavor: "I only came here to see you!" -- Basler
front.description: Charm is about creating a bond with someone at will. You can get through situations with style, panache, or force of personality.
prompts: Perform with grace and elegance
Get by on audacity
Gain someone's confidence
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Charm
back.flavor: "Listen, city boy. Stop talking or I'll cut your tongue out." -- Woody
back.description:
Some people can become enraptured by their own ability to impress and influence. They buy into the story they're selling, until reality intrudes.
Others see charm as deceit, and will trust you less.
prompts: Show off needlessly
Push things for the sake of pushing
Take advantage of someone's emotions
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Instinct
front.flavor: "My eye watches the target. My hand lets go the bowstring. I do nothing." -- Woody
front.description:
Your heart, your conscience, a divine command, or something else outweighs reason when you act.
Instinct lets you act when everything says to hesitate, when uncertainty overwhelms you, or when speed counts more than reason.
prompts: Take decisive action now
Get an immediate read on a person or situation
Leap into an opportunity
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Instinct
back.flavor: "So, he was a king's guard in disguise. He looked like a bad guy!" -- Woody
back.description: Only fools rush in, and this time, you were the fool.
prompts: Interrupt a plan mid-execution
Misjudge someone's intentions or actions
Screw something up by impulsively acting
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Magic
front.flavor: "I don't know, I just felt ... something ... flow through me!" -- Tana
front.description:
The mystical, the eldritch, the arcane. The Power has many names. What do you call it?
You can achieve a variety of supernatural outcomes with magic, such as healing, curses, enchantments, and more.
prompts: Place the impossible within reach
Mingle the material and the symbolic
Infuse the ordinary with awe and mystery
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Magic
back.flavor: "The Power is much like the ocean. You can sail in it, or drown in it." -- Tana
back.description: When called, the Power always comes. That doesn't mean you can always command it. Even familiar workings can have surprising consequences.
prompts: Face a cost you can't easily or immediately pay
Supply a rare material component or perform a ritual at specific place and time
Suffer a side effect or curse
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Secrets
front.flavor: "Basler, where did you get that knife from?" -- Tana
front.description: You deal in concealment, stealth, and subterfuge. Your tools are things people don't want known, or weren't expecting. You could use hidden weapons, court gossip, cloak-and-dagger skulduggery, or the secrets of the heart.
prompts: Acquire something from someone else without their knowledge
Reveal something you've been concealing
Avoid detection or culpability
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Secrets
back.flavor: "You don't wanna know" -- Basler
back.description: The problem with secrets is keeping track of who knows what. The value of a secret is lost once it's revealed. And some secrets weigh on the conscience.
prompts: Endure distrust from those around you
Reveal the wrong thing to the wrong person
Give yourself away at an inopportune moment
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Tech
front.flavor: "This gizmo can pick any lock in the kingdom!" -- Basler
front.description: You focus on science, technology, or artifice to get things done. This includes science like handguns or balloons, magitek such as crystal fire-rods, or alchemy such as healing potions.
prompts: Fight using advanced weapons or protective gear
Overcome obstacles by deploying a gadget
Gain advantage against those unfamiliar with your tech
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Tech
back.flavor: "The gizmo broke and I gotta fix it. Well, at least I have my tools." -- Basler
back.description: Nothing works perfectly, especially new inventions that have seen more use than testing.
prompts: The gadget has unexpected side effects or fails to work at a key moment
A gadget malfunctions or breaks in interesting ways
People distrust or avoid your strange science
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Training
front.flavor: "The mind directs the body's power. I get it now." -- Basler
front.description:
Through exercise, mindfulness, and practice, you've learned to use your own mind and body as a tool.
Training lets you act with grace, power, and precision, or overcome mundane limits.
prompts: Use your body's abilities in place of weapons, armor, or equipment
Focus inner strength to resist torment or temptation
Gain an understanding of someone from how they move
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Training
back.flavor: "Well, I can't pick locks with my fingernails, can I?" -- Basler
back.description: Your discipline is demanding, and while your body is versatile and powerful, it can't compete with everything.
prompts: Face a problem that requires tools after all
Spend time honing yourself instead of accomplishing an important goal
Reveal your abilities to someone you'd rather not see them
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Wits
front.flavor: "The world is full of opportunities!" -- Basler
front.description: Wits lets you make the most of everything around you. You turn difficulty into opportunity, find solutions within the problem you face, and look at situations in new ways.
prompts: Find a way to turn strength to or from weakness
Devise a plan to deal with a problem
Realize a useful truth about a situation
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Wits
back.flavor: "When I said people were gullible, I didn't mean me too!" -- Basler
back.description: No battle plan survives contact with the enemy, but not all planners are humble enough to realize that. Getting by on the world can sometimes mean exploiting people, or seeming like you're doing so.
prompts: Misjudge the strength of your position
Overplay your hand
Make someone else pay for your victory
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Dreamer
front.description: Tomorrow beckons, if you can fix today. You can't change the world alone. But you aren't, are you?
prompts: Remind someone of their best self
Light a candle to spite the darkness
Defy what's possible with what's necessary
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Dreamer
back.description: When the gulf between is and ought becomes too much, which will you choose?
prompts: Reject the real, denounce the realist
Forget that you have friends
Lose sight of your dream for a time
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Guardian
front.description: You feel responsible for something or someone else. Their need propels you.
prompts: Keep your charge safe from something
Identify and monitor a threat
Endure the unimaginable
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Guardian
back.description: You control that which depends on you, and sometimes the weight grows too much.
prompts: Assert your authority
Cast suspicion too widely
Shut down your feelings or shut out your charge
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Opportunist
front.description: Life is unpredictable. When an opening comes, seize it. When a chance comes, take it.
prompts: Exploit or create a weakness
Employ misdirection or deception
Take a risk nobody else would
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Opportunist
back.description: There's only so much good luck to go around. Will you run out of yours, or take someone else's away?
prompts: Kick someone when they're down
Betray a trust
Let someone else pay the price
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Performer
front.description: Through actions and words, you entertain, persuade, or transform people around you.
prompts: Embody grace, confidence, or poise
Inspire or incite people to act
Spark or manipulate emotion
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Performer
back.description: When anything you say matters, will you say the wrong thing, or for the wrong reasons?
prompts: Outshine or embarrass someone important
Draw unwanted attention
Provoke an unintended reaction
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Quester
front.description: A vow, an ideal, a promise, a vision, a mission. Something drives you unstoppably onward.
prompts: Make the hard choices your resolve demands
Rally others to your cause
Find a way forward despite everything
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Quester
back.description: That which is greater than you can also crush you beneath it.
prompts: Waver in your dedication to your quest
Shut others out of assisting you
Ignore mundane needs to focus on your quest
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Rebel
front.description: Your power, presentation, reputation, or history cause common folk to fear or reject you.
prompts: Use others' fears to your advantage
Surpass a limit or break a rule imposed by others
Make common cause with other rebels
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Rebel
back.description: To be the worst of what they say you are. How easy to do it accidentally. How tempting to choose it.
prompts: Make everything worse for yourself or an ally
Fall prey to temptation or darkness
Spark conflict or dissent
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Soldier
front.description: Life is struggle. Everyone has to fight, all the time. What do you fight for?
prompts: Test your fate against an opponent
Make a sacrifice to turn the tide
Stand up when everything says to stay down
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Soldier
back.description: Life is pain. There's no reward for this, only the next battle. When will you fall?
prompts: Lash out at an easy target
Use your power selfishly
Dismiss the peaceful alternative
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Synthesist
front.description: You create, fix, and remix.
prompts: Make something new out of what's available
Repair or recreate something
Bring creativity to bear against a problem
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Synthesist
back.description: What or who will you unmake, in your goal of making something new?
prompts: Tear down something valuable or important
Keep something going at great cost
Overuse the same solution
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Cosmopolitan
front.flavor: "The clear skies, the lure of the open road, it's perfect!" -- Tana
front.description:
You've lived among people from all over. Maybe you lived in a bustling city, or traveled the world.
You've learned to approach situations by understanding many perspectives.
prompts: Recall a story that inspires people to new ways of thinking
Bring a fresh perspective to a situation
Unite people by finding the common threads between them
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Cosmopolitan
back.flavor: "Do these wagon wheels fall off often?" -- Emory
back.description: You can mistake your breadth of experience for depth, and fail to hear wiser voices.
prompts: Overestimate your own wisdom or experience
Lose focus of people as individuals
Treat one person as representative of a whole group
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Industrious
front.flavor: "Take a deep breath of that farm air!" -- Tana
front.description:
You grew up among farmers, trappers, city laborers, or other folk who made their way by the sweat of their brow. Others expected you to carry your own weight.
You've learned to approach situations with direct, hard work.
prompts: Be sensitive to the rhythms around you--cycles of nature, or people's routines
Make do with what's on hand
Coordinate with others to get hard work done
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Industrious
back.flavor: "Smells like cow breakfast" -- Basler
back.description: Some situations demand inspiration, not perspiration. Other times, the reality of repetitive work can lull you into boredom, distraction, or despair.
prompts: Sacrifice tomorrow's hopes for today's needs
Demand someone else live up to your work ethic
Lose sight of something important
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Insular
front.flavor: "This is all very different from the cloister" -- Emory
front.description: You grew up secluded from the rest of the world. Whether you lived on a lonely mountain village, a religious retreat, or a city enclave, the ways of the outside world are a mystery that must now be solved.
prompts: Solve a problem using your peoples' ways
Ask naive but insightful questions
Reveal hidden knowledge or exclusive experience
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Insular
back.flavor: "Everything's different out here. That's why it's called a cloister" -- Basler
back.description: Your early life didn't prepare you for the variey of people and things the world has to offer. You might make a faux pas or ask an embarrassingly obvious question.
prompts: Violate unspoken rules or cultural taboos
Cause conflict through misunderstanding
Fall back on questionable assumptions
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Mercantile
front.flavor: "Welcome to the Labri Market! You can find anything here." -- Basler
front.description:
You grew up among those who live via bargaining: a city's markets, an ocean trade route, or the corridors of power in an embassy or castle.
You've learned to approach situations through negotiation.
prompts: Make a deal or haggle over details
Navigate a complex or ambiguous situation
Gauge someone's wants or needs
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Mercantile
back.flavor: "...For the right price." -- Basler
back.description:
You know that some people have wants and needs, that others can satisfy them, and that power comes from mediating between the two.
It's easy to get addicted to that power.
prompts: Compromise a principle or ideal for expedience
Put a price on service
Treat people as assets or commodities
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Solitary
front.flavor: "I got this, leave me alone" -- Woody
front.description:
For much of your life, you've been on your own. You might have been orphaned or abandoned or kidnapped. You might have run away from home, or home might no longer exist.
You've learned to approach situations through isolation.
prompts: Shut out distractions
Present a reassuring facade
Keep moving even when hope is lost
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Solitary
back.flavor: "You've left yourself alone too long" -- Tana
back.description: Without experiencing what other people in your life can do, you may fear what you need most from them: an outlet. When you act distant, others will reciprocate.
prompts: Accumulate emotional debt
Keep your reservations unspoken
Leave others behind to fend for themselves
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Strict
front.flavor: "Knights should be glorious champions of honor!" -- Emory
front.description:
There's a right and wrong way to do things. Right? You might be from a noble family where things are done just so, or grew up cautious thanks to constant danger.
You've learned to approach situations through protocol.
prompts: Uphold a code of behavior in the face of doubt or weakness
Use the training or skills that led to your code's adoption
Inspire or counsel others using your code
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Strict
back.flavor: "As opposed to ironclad thugs lording it over the peasants?" -- Basler
back.description: Committing to a way of life can help you push forward, but make you inflexible and stubborn.
prompts: Refuse to adapt your code to new or difficult situations
See the world through a narrow lens
Disdain or punish those who don't conform to your expectations
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Underclass
front.flavor: "Nobody fights for people like us. So we fight for ourselves." -- Basler
front.description:
You grew up among people who were neglected or rejected by a surrounding society: criminals, migrants, or members of a mistreated minority.
You've learned to approach situations via pride.
prompts: Stand up for yourself and those like you
Rally the downtrodden
Obtain your needs through a social network
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Underclass
back.flavor: "When everyone hates you, it's hard not to hate them back." -- Basler
back.description: Sometimes, circumstances push people to a breaking point. Other times, doing the right thing becomes impossible, and you're left with doing the necessary thing.
prompts: Lash out at threats to your ego
Build yourself up in the eyes of the impressionable
Run afoul of those in power
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Unfettered
front.flavor: "As a princess, I had power. As a ranger, I have freedom." -- Woody
front.description:
Whether a scion of privilege, the free-spirited offspring of tolerant parents, or a feral child in a mystic forest, you've always done what you saw fit.
You've learned to approach situations through force of will.
prompts: Force an issue or break a deadlock through action
Reject restrictions and break chains
Drag others along your unique path
front.rule: Flip to get a hit.

back.name: Unfettered
back.flavor: "Those who go their own way often find the path lonely." -- Emory
back.description: Rules aren't always made to be broken. You can offend others, or even hurt them or yourself when you go where you don't belong or do what you ought not do.
prompts: Sabotage a subtle effort
Trample on a cherished tradition
Disappoint or frustrate a more cautious ally
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Character Cards
front.description:
To create a new PC, pick three cards: Focus, Role, and Origin. You can choose cards at random, or select them yourself.
These cards describe the traits that you want to spotlight during the game. Just because someone else has the Courage card doesn't mean your character isn't courageous, only that it's not going to be the quality you're focusing on.
prompts: Front: get a hit by flipping the card
Back: flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone
front.rule: Other side is identical

back.name: Character Cards
back.description:
To create a new PC, pick three cards: Focus, Role, and Origin. You can choose cards at random, or select them yourself.
These cards describe the traits that you want to spotlight during the game. Just because someone else has the Courage card doesn't mean your character isn't courageous, only that it's not going to be the quality you're focusing on.
prompts: Front: get a hit by flipping the card
Back: flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone
back.rule: Other side is identical

front.name: Condition Cards
front.description:
You can take a condition to get a hit. Describe how. You can flip a front-side condition to worsen it and get a hit. Describe how. Players who challenge you can suggest conditions to meet it.
The condition is fictionally true and limits your actions. Other players can pose a challenge if a condition would interfere with something you do. Discard any conditions that no longer apply in the fiction.
Individual condition cards describe how to clear them.
front.rule: Flip to see examples

back.name: Condition Examples
back.description: Conditions are a way to achieve success at a cost.
prompts: You take Disarmed to score a final sword blow
Another player suggests that touching the idol will leave you Magicked
Take Weakened to stay within the poison cloud
You're already Hurt, but you can worsen it to Wounded to launch a final desperate attack
Spend a scene being healed by a priestess to discard Hurt, or a week of downtime doing odd jobs to discard Indebted
back.rule: Flip to see rules

front.name: Hurt
front.flavor: "Ow! Watch who you carve up with that thing!" -- Basler
front.description: You've been bloodied, bruised, stunned, or suffered some other temporary physical harm. You can't exert yourself too much without making it worse.
prompts: An enemy attacked you
You took a long fall or hit something heavy
You were in a natural disaster or magical calamity
front.rule: Flip to worsen the condition and get a hit. Discard by spending a scene attending to the condition.
NOTES: is how the condition limits the fiction
I want to know how that changes the fictional situation for your character moving forward.

back.name: Wounded
back.flavor: "It's...just a scratch..." -- Emory
back.description:
You've been seriously injured. Every step is painful, and it's hard to concentrate. You can't move very fast or fight effectively.
Who or what holds you together until you can be treated? Will you have scars afterward?
prompts: You suffered major blood loss
You broke a bone
You were pierced by arrows, spears, or claws
back.rule: Discard by spending downtime attending to the condition.
NOTES: is how the condition limits the fiction
I want to know how that changes the fictional situation for your character moving forward.

front.name: Weakened
front.flavor: "This forest goes on forever, Woody. Can we just stop a moment?" -- Tana
front.description: Your body is trying to keep itself going, but is under attack or is being deprived. You can't push yourself too hard, and it's hard to concentrate.
prompts: Fatigue or sleep deprivation
Hunger and thirst
Poison, disease, or infection
Exposure to the elements
front.rule: Flip to worsen the condition and get a hit. Discard by spending a scene attending to the condition.
NOTES: is how the condition limits the fiction
I want to know how that changes the fictional situation for your character moving forward.

back.name: Exhausted
back.flavor: "The leaf dragon's toxin got me... Sorry..." -- Woody
back.description: Your body is out of resources. You need rest, sustenance, or medication.
prompts: Extended lack of sleep
Starvation or dehydration
Serious illness or poison
Delerium or hallucinations
Burns or frostbite
back.rule: Discard by spending downtime attending to the condition.
NOTES: is how the condition limits the fiction
I want to know how that changes the fictional situation for your character moving forward.

front.name: Obliged
front.flavor: "We will deal with the brigands, your highness." -- Emory
front.description: You have a responsibility and face punishment for failure or delay. Discharging the debt may be expensive, risky, or troublesome.
prompts: Deliver an item or message to someone
Lean on an individual or group
Promise a favor later for a purchase now
Swear a magically binding oath
front.rule: Flip to worsen the condition and get a hit. Discard by spending a scene attending to the condition.
NOTES: is how the condition limits the fiction
I want to know how that changes the fictional situation for your character moving forward.

back.name: Indebted
back.flavor: "I kinda told the thieves' guild I'd take care of something" -- Basler
back.description: You have significant debts that demand repayment. Your creditor is watching,  and their rivals may offer you a devil's bargain to escape.
prompts: Carry out illegal or dangerous activities
Work with a rival or enemy to achieve a goal
Sacrifice comrades or principles to avoid punishment
back.rule: Discard by spending downtime attending to the condition.
NOTES: is how the condition limits the fiction
I want to know how that changes the fictional situation for your character moving forward.

front.name: Wanted
front.flavor: "I think they saw us." -- Tana
front.description: Someone or something powerful or dangerous is seeking you out, and you'd rather not be found. You risk discovery from guards, spies, or informants.
prompts: You broke the law or offended someone important
Locals are suspicious
You attracted official attention
You're in a dangerous animal's territory
front.rule: Flip to worsen the condition and get a hit. Discard by spending a scene attending to the condition.
NOTES: is how the condition limits the fiction
I want to know how that changes the fictional situation for your character moving forward.

back.name: Pursued
back.flavor: "They definitely saw us!" -- Basler
back.description: You are being actively hunted by someone or something that wishes you ill. You must stay hidden, disguise yourself when in the open, and perhaps make dangerous deals with those who offer shelter.
prompts: Wanted posters or official notices
Guards raised an alarm
You're in enemy territory or surrounded
back.rule: Discard by spending downtime attending to the condition.
NOTES: is how the condition limits the fiction
I want to know how that changes the fictional situation for your character moving forward.

front.name: Magicked
front.flavor: "If anything in the forest looks edible, it's a faerie trap" -- Woody
front.description: A spell or other supernatural power has bound you. It might cause inconvenience, impose new rules on you, or alter your perceptions.
prompts: Charms, illusions, delusions, and deceptions
Magical prohibitions against entering or leaving a place
front.rule: Flip to worsen the condition and get a hit. Discard by spending a scene attending to the condition.
NOTES: is how the condition limits the fiction
I want to know how that changes the fictional situation for your character moving forward.

back.name: Cursed
back.flavor: "That berry was delicious. Hey, who are all of you?" -- Emory
back.description:
A powerful and baneful magic has you in its grip. You might be forced to act in certain ways, or barred from acting in others.
The rules of the curse may be a mystery. You may suffer pain or great misfortune violating them.
prompts: Misfortune or calamity hounds you
A ban against doing some common thing
back.rule: Discard by spending downtime attending to the condition.
NOTES: is how the condition limits the fiction
I want to know how that changes the fictional situation for your character moving forward.

front.name: Altered
front.flavor: "Don't let them peck you, or you'll croak with the voice of the Raven God" -- Woody
front.description: Powerful magic has physically changed your appearance or abilities. You'll have trouble doing things you took for granted, but the new form may offer new advantages.
prompts: Animal traits like tails or claws
Limbs turned to stone or plants
Ethereal or elemental body
front.rule: Flip to worsen the condition and get a hit. Discard by spending a scene attending to the condition.
NOTES: is how the condition limits the fiction
I want to know how that changes the fictional situation for your character moving forward.

back.name: Transformed
back.flavor: "Hey, that raven looks familiar... Basler?!" -- Tana
back.description: You've been physically remade into something new by powerful magic. You can still function, but it's a big adjustment. Other people may react with fear, curiosity, or hostility. You may be unable to speak or explain yourself to them.
prompts: Polymorphed into an animal
Changed into a supernatural creature
Made undead or demonic
back.rule: Discard by spending downtime attending to the condition.
NOTES: is how the condition limits the fiction
I want to know how that changes the fictional situation for your character moving forward.

front.name: Undergeared
front.flavor: "This is the last of our fresh water." -- Woody
front.description: Vital gear has been damaged, or resources are running low. You must ration what remains, or improvise a replacement.
prompts: Blunted or broken weapons, low on arrows
Damaged or partial armor
Malfunctioning magical tools
Lacking food, water, or medicine
front.rule: Flip to worsen the condition and get a hit. Discard by spending a scene attending to the condition.
NOTES: is how the condition limits the fiction
I want to know how that changes the fictional situation for your character moving forward.

back.name: Ungeared
back.flavor: "The flood washed away our campsite! Now what?" -- Basler
back.description: Your gear or supplies have been broken, lost, or taken. You must scavenge for substitutes or make do with bare-bones replacements.
prompts: Equipment lost in floods or other calamity
Stripped of weapons by enemies
Magical tools disenchanted
Completely without rations or shelter
back.rule: Discard by spending downtime attending to the condition.
NOTES: is how the condition limits the fiction
I want to know how that changes the fictional situation for your character moving forward.

front.name: Hindered
front.flavor: "This arm is useless for drawing a bow right now." -- Woody
front.description: Your body, mind, or senses are in temporary disorder. You might have overtaxed yourself, or suffered from injury or stress. You may be in the grip of a powerful emotion or anxiety.
prompts: Loss of mobility
Blurred vision or dizziness
Shock or mental imbalance
Overwhelming emotion
front.rule: Flip to worsen the condition and get a hit. Discard by spending a scene attending to the condition.
NOTES: is how the condition limits the fiction
I want to know how that changes the fictional situation for your character moving forward.

back.name: Impeded
back.flavor: "I can't feel the grimoire! I can't feel ANY magic!" -- Tana
back.description: A sense or faculty you normally depend on has been temporarily lost. You might have pushed yourself past a limit, or been affected by a disease or magical effect. You are unable to use the affected abilities.
prompts: Temporarily blind or deaf
Unable to cast spells or use other special abilities
A breakdown or dissociation
back.rule: Discard by spending downtime attending to the condition.
NOTES: is how the condition limits the fiction
I want to know how that changes the fictional situation for your character moving forward.

front.name: Random Outcome
front.description:
You can choose to draw a card of this type to see if you meet a challenge.
The card will suggest ways in which the challenge was met. You can use one of these, or make up your own. If a card indicates that you missed, you may not try to meet the challenge in other ways.
You may adjust the ratio of hit or miss cards in this stack to reflect the difficulty of a given action.
front.rule: Draw a random card from this stack, flip to see the outcome

back.name: Hit
back.description: You successfully met the challenge! Narrate how it happened.
prompts: Luck or coincidence made it work somehow
You were carrying the right item at the right moment
Allies intervened in your favor
An important lesson from your past came to mind
back.rule: Discard to generate a hit

front.name: Random Outcome
front.description:
You can choose to draw a card of this type to see if you meet a challenge.
The card will suggest ways in which the challenge was met. You can use one of these, or make up your own. If a card indicates that you missed, you may not try to meet the challenge in other ways.
You may adjust the ratio of hit or miss cards in this stack to reflect the difficulty of a given action.
front.rule: Draw a random card from this stack, flip to see the outcome

back.name: Miss
back.description: You failed to meet the challenge! Narrate how it happened.
prompts: Bad luck or unhappy coincidence
Your equipment failed or you left something behind
Allies were thwarted, absent, or ineffective
Overconfidence sabotaged your success
back.rule: Discard this card

front.name: Emotion
front.description:
Oracle cards can answer questions. Draw one card for a simple answer, or two cards for a complex one.
Use these cards to answer what someone is feeling, or what emotion a thing or event would spark.
Each emotion has two neighbors. You can use the emotion itself, or choose to mix it with a neighbor.
front.rule: Flip to reveal an answer

back.name: Ecstacy
back.description:
Ecstacy, Joy, or Serenity.
With Vigilance: yields Optimism.
With Admiration: yields Love.
prompts: Who in the scene feels this emotion? Who ought to, but does not?
Should this emotion be affirmed, resisted, revealed, or concealed?
back.rule: Discard and shuffle into related cards

front.rule: Flip to reveal an answer

With Ecstacy: yields Love.
With Terror: yields Submission.
prompts: Who in the scene feels this emotion? Who ought to, but does not?
Should this emotion be affirmed, resisted, revealed, or concealed?
back.rule: Discard and shuffle into related cards

front.name: Armored
front.flavor: "My daggers bounced off that plate mail! What now?" -- Basler
front.description: This encounter includes something important that is heavily defended. This could mean body armor of leather or metal, hardened barriers of stone, or wood, a protective aura of magic, a divine blessing, and more.
prompts: Ignore harm from inadequate attacks
Destroy weaker things that strike it or are struck by it
Stand in defense of allies
front.rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

back.name: Armored
back.flavor: "You know what metal does? Heats up. Fireball!" -- Tana
back.description: Every armor has a weakness or comes at a cost, like making someone slower or something heavier. Not every armor's weakness is obvious, and finding it may be difficult.
prompts: Those protected have limited mobility and senses
Weakness to specific damage types, e.g. lightning
Useless if penetrated or lost
back.rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

front.name: Base
front.flavor: "That's a big castle..." -- Basler
front.description: A Base can be a temporary encampment, an outpost, a secret headquarters, a wild animal's den, or some other protected space. You might need to find something specific, get in or out, or confront the occupants.
prompts: Bases can have numerous occupants
Traps, labyrinthine structure, or other clever preparations
Ways to cut off escape routes or confine interlopers
front.rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

back.name: Base
back.flavor: "The tyrant king doesn't know about these secret tunnels" -- Emory
back.description: While Bases can be big and imposing, their nature can work against their occupants. The bigger the Base, the more likely it is to hold something helpful.
prompts: Contain secrets about the plans and activities of its occupants
Hold resources, weapons, or captives
Include defensible choke points or hiding spots
back.rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

front.name: Diabolical
front.flavor: "Back, foul fiend! Light will overcome you!" -- Emory
front.description: A Diabolical encounter has the touch of evil. An actual summoned demon, a possessed victim, or a dark and malevolent force are all Diabolic.
prompts: Seek to corrupt or influence the vulnerable
Exploit moral weaknesses or dark secrets
Expose its true nature and hellish powers
front.rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

back.name: Diabolical
back.flavor: "Basler, stop cringing. He's not talking about you." -- Woody
back.description:
Evil hasn't won, though it keeps trying. Powers from beyond are bound by their own rules too, and can be defeated accordingly.
Characters who arm themselves with occult lore or divine blessings may circumvent or neutralize a Diabolical power.
prompts: Be susceptible to folk incantations or rituals
Recoil from the pure of heart
Flee to fight another day
back.rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

front.name: Elemental
front.flavor: "Earth sprites. They have the ore we seek." -- Tana
front.description: Powerful forces of nature such as volcanoes, storms, as well as elemental entities.
prompts: Create, animate, or manipulate its element in useful or dangerous ways
Change the environment with aspects of its element, such as making rivers of fire or barriers of wind
Counteract an opposing element, such as fire vs. water
front.rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

back.name: Elemental
back.flavor: "They had some nice gemstones too!" -- Basler
back.description: Each element has rules. Water flows. Fire burns, but not without fuel. Some elements can counteract others. These rules can be exploited.
prompts: Be vulnerable to their element's normal vulnerabilities or rules
Require a nearby source of the element
back.rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

front.name: Flying
front.flavor: "Did something just swoop overhead?" -- Emory
front.description: This encounter includes something flying or airborne. Winged creatures, skilled magicians, and floating platforms can ignore earthbound attackers and require effort to reach.
prompts: Strike targets on the ground without risking counterattacks
Move faster than those trapped on the ground, or reach places they can't
See greater distances
front.rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

back.name: Flying
back.flavor: "Meet my best girl, Annette! A net, get it?" -- Basler
back.description: Wings require energy to sustain flight and can be fragile. Magical flight can be counter-spelled. Turbulent air or nets can force flyers down.
prompts: Become entangled, trapped, or confined in ways that negate flight
Be unable to lift heavy loads or fly under difficult conditions
Suffer harm if they fall
back.rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

front.name: Gang
front.flavor: "They outnumber us 5 to 1, folks!" -- Basler
front.description: A group of beings bound together in common purpose. Gangs can be organized, like criminal gangs or military units, or informal groups like angry mobs or animal packs.
prompts: Surround or isolate individuals through strength in numbers
Shout down or bully a lone voice
Bring a variety of skills or resources to bear on a problem
front.rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

back.name: Gang
back.flavor: "Sounds like fair odds to me. Have at you!" -- Emory
back.description: The strength of a gang is in its numbers. Without a strong leader, the gang obeys its collective impulses. Individual members can be isolated and confronted.
prompts: Have competing impulses or mixed sympathies or agendas
Fall apart if a leader is weakened or shamed
Follow a new leader or impulse that better matches its agenda
back.rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

front.name: Hybrid
front.flavor: "A Gryphon. The heraldic symbol of my kingdom. Majestic!" -- Emory
front.description: A Hybrid being is made up of two or more things, not always living. Such beings can be part-human (mermaids, harpies), mixed animal (cockatrices, pegasi), shapeshifters (werewolves), or weirder (tree-ogres).
prompts: Use the best of their combined abilities
Use different abilities together in some unique way
front.rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

back.name: Hybrid
back.flavor: "That thing was terrifying! Your kingdom is messed up!" -- Basler
back.description: Not every hybrid has a perfect command of its own nature. Hybrids must also obey the rules of all their component parts.
prompts: Suffer the vulnerabilities of any of their contributing parts
Become confused by conflicting impulses or instincts
back.rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

front.name: Large
front.flavor: "The bigger they are, the harder they fall!" -- Tana
front.description: This encounter includes something of enormous size. It might be naturally large, like a dragon or a giant, or have been enlarged by magic or other forces.
prompts: Resist human-scale attacks or effects
Reach or hit an entire area at once
Deal devastating damage to smaller creatures and objects
front.rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

back.name: Large
back.flavor: "Just as long as it doesn't fall on us." -- Basler
back.description: You may have trouble engaging with a Large encounter due to the size difference, but that trouble goes both ways. It can be hard for Large things to perceive or target smaller foes.
prompts: Lose track of small details or targets
Be easily targeted due to its size
Move slowly or clumsily
back.rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

front.name: Monstrous
front.flavor: "That ain't no ordinary wolf, folks.." -- Basler
front.description: Monstrous threats are altered forms of the familiar. They are fiercer, more feral, or disturbingly unnatural, the nightmarishly distorted vision of the original.
prompts: Lash out viciously
Use their adaptions to overwhelm the unprepared
Terrify onlookers with their awful nature
front.rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

back.name: Monstrous
back.flavor: "Whoever corrupted this creature will pay. Let's find them." -- Woody
back.description: A Monstrous threat is powered by its rage or aggression, but often lack a sense of self-preservation, fighting relentlessly when others would retreat.
prompts: Lose themselves in their own ferocity
Fall into traps when goaded
Misunderstand those not driven by similar instincts
back.rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

front.name: Notorious
front.flavor: "That's Gretamaw, the Beaked Butcher!" -- Basler
front.description: A monster whispered of by fearful villagers. A lonely place of power. An artifact of legend, replete with arcane power. A person sung of by the bards. The weight of its reputation or its followers may be as much of a danger as its own power.
prompts: Dominate with their presence
Live up to the legend in a big way
Reveal an unexpected ability
front.rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

back.name: Notorious
back.flavor: "Save the beak. We need it to claim the reward!" -- Basler
back.description: The stories about this encounter might give you clues on how to deal with it. But stories are just that, stories. You might correctly leverage its lore, or look at it with fresh eyes and discover a truth the bards omitted.
prompts: Behave or react predictably
Be less, or other, than the stories say
Be part of another unguessed story
back.rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

front.name: Portentous
front.flavor: "Where are all those crows going?" -- Tana
front.description: This encounter foreshadows something important. It can be a mystical experience, laden with dreams and prophecy, or just a mundane glimpse into a momentous reality beyond.
prompts: Give a taste of things to come
Force people into hard moral or personal choices
Subtly mingle the mundane and the symbolic or dreamlike
front.rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

back.name: Portentous
back.flavor: "They're going the same way we are. Come on." -- Woody
back.description: The Portentous is the first step on a larger road. It both surprises characters, and prepares them for what is next. If the future cannot be changed, it can be met with eyes open. And you will only know if fate can be defied by trying.
prompts: Reveal an important clue or suggest a strategy
Unlock a hidden strength or personal conviction
back.rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

front.name: Spectral
front.flavor: "My arrows go right through it." -- Woody
front.description: This encounter includes something ghostly or purely spiritual. Spectral entities might have obligations or passions binding them to the mortal world. They may be frightened, angry, or confused. They might wish to go - or to stay.
prompts: Bypass solid obstacles
Wield morbid magics like chilling touch or possession
Ravenously pursue something the living have that it wants
front.rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

back.name: Spectral
back.flavor: "I'll have a magic circle up in a moment!" -- Tana
back.description: Spectral beings are only visitors in the waking world. Their anchors are tenuous, and they may leave if given what they want or be forced out by those who know how.
prompts: Be weakened or repulsed by warding rituals
Fall prey to their passions
back.rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

front.name: Tense
front.flavor: "Deep breaths. Stay calm. Show them we're friends." -- Tana
front.description: The encounter includes a highly charged situation. One or more parties might be on edge, ready for confrontation with another. Can you navigate it without making everything worse?
prompts: Lash out with ill-considered action
Make bad assessments or assume the worst
Heedlessly run away, often making things worse
front.rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

back.name: Tense
back.flavor: "You mean the real villain all this time was...?!" -- Emory
back.description: If you discover the reason for a Tense situation, you can find a ways to defuse it. You can talk others down if you aren't caught up in the situation yourself.
prompts: Overcome mistrust through negotiation
Reveal facts that counter false assumptions
Make compromises and sacrifices in the name of peace
back.rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

front.name: Toxic
front.flavor: "Don't let it touch you! Your skin will rot away!" -- Woody
front.description: Venomous creatures, assassins with poisoned blades,  swamp gasses, and many other things can afflict you with sickness. Poisons can be fast acting and deadly, or gradually debilitating.
prompts: Sicken anyone in contact with them
Fend off an attack with the threat of toxin
